result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Voucher to DOA for Polk Co Treas to pay $1533.50 to Atty Murtaugh for Ct App'ted Atty Fees. Def assessed for atty fees, PP set up, Copies to def.
Bond applied to fines/costs owing in 15CF204.

CASES: 15CF204, 15CF270 Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 1220PM 15CF204- Ct 1 & 2- Def pleas of G. CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC. DRI 15CF270. Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote. Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge. CT- PSI long form, agent need not be present, PSI due by noon on 1/25/16. Appear at probation today. bond cont. Atty Murtaugh req bond mod on 15CF270. CT holds cash posted for sent. on 204 case. 12:30pm adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

CASES:  15CF204, 15CF270.  Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 10:48 am Atty Murtaugh - no resolution yet, but may come to one.  JA to set for JT.  Bond cont.  10:50 am adj.

CASES:  15CF204, 15CF270.  Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh via telephone WLC.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 1:28 pm Def to attend Sal Army in Milwaukee.  $1300 posted already.  Atty Murtaugh - to modify bond to $1300.  State - objects.  CT - Sal Army is not trmt.  Bond mod is denied.  1:32 pm adj.
Defendant's - for Reduction of Bail.  Submitted by Atty Murtaugh.
Defendant's - for Discovery and Inspection.  Submitted by Atty Murtaugh.
Def- plea NG. CT accepts plea.

Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL/JP-clerk 9:48 am. AGrim- S&T. No cross. ADA argument.  CT- finds PC. CT binds over. ADA files info. JA to schedule. Bond cont. 10:00 am adj.

CASES: 15CF204, 15CF270 Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 3:58PM In 15CF270- cannot make payments. If cannot make payment, turn self into jail. bond cont. 4:10pm adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

CAN BE PAID IN PAYMENTS:  MUST PAY $400.00 TO GET OUT OF JAIL- THIS IS JULY'S PAYMENT, THEN PAY $400.00 ON 8/10/15 AND THE 10TH OF EACH MONTH UNTIL PAID IN FULL.  Must have clean UA before release from jail.   Absolute Sobriety. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.   Not to have contact with: Miranda Gentz and Brendan Gentz.   Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.

Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in court, with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad by phone.  Defendant Jeramy L. Norlander in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 10:30am Atty Murtaugh atty of record on other files. 10:35AM ADJ.  Review scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
